column1: If the test is done at home, you use a test kit.
These include vitamin C, aspirin, and nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) such as ibuprofen and naproxen.

Abnormal results may be due to problems that cause bleeding in the stomach or intestinal tract, including: - Colon cancer or other gastrointestinal (GI) tumors - Colon polyps - Bleeding veins in the esophagus or stomach (esophageal varices and portal hypertensive gastropathy) - Inflammation of the esophagus (esophagitis) - Inflammation of the stomach (gastritis) from GI infections - Hemorrhoids - Inflammatory bowel disease - Peptic ulcer Other causes of positive test may include: - Nosebleed - Coughing up blood and then swallowing it.
